abstract: Coalition of labor unions and contractors begin media and lobbying campaign in effort to makes changes to 421-a tax abatement program, which they say gives developers in New York large tax breaks but little incentive to provide affordable housing; program is scheduled to expire on June 15 unless Legislature takes action.
lead_paragraph: An alliance of New York labor unions and contractors wants officials to make changes to the 421-a abatement program, which it says gives developers large tax breaks for little in return.

headline.main: Lobbying Campaign Aims to Overhaul Housing Tax Abatement Plan
headline.print_headline: Coalition Seeks Changes to a Tax Abatement Plan

snippet: An alliance of New York labor unions and contractors wants officials to make changes to the 421-a abatement program, which it says gives developers large tax breaks for little in return.
